results.title: Summertime
results.creator_credit: Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: A non-narrated montage of a series of images to give an impression of the Australian summer, ranging from country scenes to suburban beaches.

results.title: Summerhill (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dennis Miller, Cecily Burwash and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Visits England’s progressive co-educational boarding school, Summerhill, founded by Alexander Neill a half century ago. Aims to show that students can make decisions about their studies without lessening the quality of their education.

results.title: Summerfield [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ken Hannam, Patricia Lovell and Clare Beach Films
results.brief_description: When a newcomer arrives in a small, secluded town to discover that the former teacher has disappeared, he probes into the mystery and becomes more and more intrigued by the inhabitants of a forbidding house called Summerfield. Eventually, the secrets of Summerfield are revealed in a dramatic ending with a shock twist. Directed by Ken Hannam (director of “Sunday Too Far Away”) and starring, Nick Tate, Elizabeth Alexander and John Waters, “Summerfield” was shot on location at Victoria’s Phillip and Churchill Islands.

results.title: Summer, or grief
results.brief_description: In this single-channel videotape, a sequence of personal, light-filled images alternates with single words and short phrases in a stark white font against black background. The imagery consists of stills, pans, tracking shots, and long pulls-to-focus of everyday subjects photographed in and around the artist’s summer home in Upstate New York over the course of several summers. The text, an excerpt from `The Conversation’ by poet Allen Grossman, is an eloquent but dark meditation on loss and the passage of time. The tape is about appearance and interiority, surface and undercurrent, and the coexistence of the dark in the light, apprehension and beauty in common experience.

results.title: Summer with Monika = Sommaren med Monika
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Allan Ekelund and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: When Harry (Lars Ekborg) meets Monika (Harriet Andersson) in a cafe they soon fall in love. Monika leaves home after an argument with her father and the young lovers run away on Harry’s father’s boat. They spend a carefree summer on the boat until Monika discovers she is pregnant and they are forced to return to Stockholm. As a married couple struggling to make a living Harry and Monika soon find their love disintegrating. Once again, Ingmar Bergman totally engrosses us in this sensitive study of young love, eliciting great performances from Lars Ekborg as the ernest Harry and Harriet Andersson as the wild and willful Monika. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Summer school in Singapore
results.brief_description: As part of the Colombo Plan thirty-five students from Cambodia and Laos were invited by the United Kingdom Government to attend a summer-school in Singapore for a six-week course in the English language. The school was held in the University of Malaya and the students came from varied walks of life - government officials, teachers and high-school students. Emphasis was laid on conversational English, its rhythm, pronunciation and vocabulary.

results.title: Summer scene
results.brief_description: Shows tourist attractions of Western Australia’s South West region in spring and summer. Includes wildflowers, spectacular Karri forests near Pemberton and the Pemberton swimming pool, trout fishing, and Yallingup’s caves and rocky coastal beaches.

results.title: Summer pageantry
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, Hector Lemieux and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: It is a sight to gladden the heart of every spectator when the changing of the guard takes place on the broad green lawns of Ottawa’s Parliament Buildings and when the band of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police plays their sunset Retreat. Both traditional ceremonies are shown in full colour, as are other points of interest in and around the city including scenic drives and waterways, historic stone buildings and modern edifices.
